channel.title: Hard drive question
channel.description:
Hey guys, so my internet isint working so i restart...when its starting up it gives me the error 'error loading operating system'
any solutions? if i put another hard drive as primary and this one as secondary then how can i retrieve files off of the admin's desktop?
or if i dont need to format please offer some other solutions. Thanks

item.title: Hard drive question
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“arraness14, post:5, topic:272147”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=359081.msg2740339#msg2740339 date=1239316424]
This means the boot partition is not recognized. You could attempt to boot from a live CD and mount that disk.
[/quote]

what do you mean live cd?

update: I brought a hardrive and put it as primary and it didint boot. So i took my harddrive and put it as primary on another computer and i get the same error " error loading OS"… So i put mine as secondary in another computer and it wont open it. it says “the disk in drive D is not formatted, do you want to format it now?”…[/quote]
A live CD? A bootable CD?

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive question
item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

T4_:

This means the boot partition is not recognized. You could attempt to boot from a live CD and mount that disk.

what do you mean live cd?

update: I brought a hardrive and put it as primary and it didint boot. So i took my harddrive and put it as primary on another computer and i get the same error " error loading OS"… So i put mine as secondary in another computer and it wont open it. it says “the disk in drive D is not formatted, do you want to format it now?”…

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive question
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

T4_:

You could attempt to boot from a live CD and mount that disk.

Puppy Linux is a Linux Live CD thats ~100mb and comes with a load of filesystem programs with a nice GUI. I used it for system recovery once at it worked a treat!

Read full topic

item.title: Hard drive question
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

What operating system do you use?

i know vista offers a “setup repair” which should fix that error, if not xp has a repair option also, choose the second repair option.

(insert disc, press any key… follow setup)

Read full topic
